item.title: Preventing Real-world Doxing by Cataloging Incidents: A Doxing Incident Database
item.description:
Abstract

This paper introduces the Doxing Incident Database (DID), a structured repository of real-world doxing incidents.
By organizing cases with metadata such as victim profile, platform, and incident timeline, the database enables large-scale analysis and helps researchers, policymakers, and journalists understand online harm patterns.

Citation

Shan, G., Riedl, C., & Xue, F. (2025). Preventing Real-world Doxing by Cataloging Incidents: A Doxing Incident Database. SSRN Working Paper.

External Link

item.title: Research on System of Access and Benefit Sharing of Traditional Knowledge Related to Genetic Resources
item.description:
Abstract

The paper examines Chinaâ€™s legal and policy frameworks for the access and benefit sharing (ABS) of traditional knowledge associated with genetic resources. It evaluates current legislation, identifies challenges, and proposes improvements to ensure fairness and biodiversity conservation in compliance with international agreements.

Citation

Xue, B.-P., & Xue, F. (2022). Research on System of Access and Benefit Sharing of Traditional Knowledge Related to Genetic Resources. Journal of MUC (Natural Sciences Edition).

External Link
